subject: Art & Design
title: Shot Composition: Close-Ups to Wide Shots
description: Learn Shot Composition: Close-Ups to Wide Shots in one minute.

hook.text: A close-up of a ticking clock. Cut to a wide shot of an empty room. The shot size changes the tension.

buildup.text: Wide shots establish location. Medium shots show interaction. Close-ups reveal emotion and detail.

discovery.text: The extreme close-up ‚Äî just the eyes ‚Äî creates maximum intensity. Sergio Leone made it his signature.

twist.text: A close-up in a wide room feels intimate. A wide shot in a tiny space feels claustrophobic. Context is everything.

climax.text: Directors plan shot sequences: wide to establish, medium to develop, close-up for the emotional peak.

punchline.text: Shot size isn't a technical choice. It's an emotional instruction.

quiz.question: What is the primary purpose of a close-up shot in film?
options: To reveal emotion and intimate detail
